summary: This is a formal letter from attorneys Michael C. Miller and Martin G. Weinberg, representing the estate of Jeffrey Epstein, to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter requests specific documents and records from the Department of Justice related to Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, citing serious irregularities and the need for their own investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at approximately 6:30 a.m. He was transported to a hospital and pronounced dead. The FBI is investigating the incident.

events.title: Attorney General Barr's Statement on Irregularities
events.description: Attorney General William P. Barr stated publicly that 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility demanded a thorough investigation.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died in federal custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m., from an apparent suicide.
Attorneys for Epstein's estate are formally requesting specific evidence from the DOJ, including video recordings, entry/exit logs, and guard logs from the MCC for the period surrounding his death.
Attorney General William Barr publicly acknowledged 'serious irregularities' at the MCC facility that demanded investigation.
The New York City Office of Chief Medical Examiner (OCME) initially delayed releasing a determination on the cause and manner of death, citing a need for further information.
The letter establishes that Epstein's legal team intended to conduct their own independent investigation into the circumstances of his death.
